PenetrationTest.Introduction: Penetration tests play a crucial role in cybersecurity, allowing organizations to detect and correct vulnerabilities before they can be exploited by malicious attackers.

Phases.Name: Pre-engagement
Phases.Description: Documentation must be completed to define the legal context and frame the audit. This involves creating a scoping document for the test.

Tools.Name: VMware
Tools.Description: Virtual machine software used for setting up pentesting environments.

Tools.Name: Virtualbox
Tools.Description: Another virtual machine software useful for creating isolated environments.

Tools.Name: QEMU/KVM
Tools.Description: A virtual machine platform for Linux that offers robust options for managing VMs.

Tools.Name: Maltego
Tools.Description: An interactive data mining tool that renders directed graphs for link analysis.

Tools.Name: Metasploit Framework
Tools.Description: Collection of remote exploits and post exploitation tools for all platforms.

Tools.Name: Burpsuite
Tools.Description: Can be used as a proxy as well as an active scanner for web applications.

Checklist: Determination of the type of pentest (Blackbox, Whitebox)
Key objectives behind this penetration test
Location address and contact if it is an onsite job
Validation that the Authorization Letter has been signed
URL of the web application that is in scope and validation that is accessible
2 sets of credentials (normal and admin) and validation that they are working
Determination of the environment (Production or UAT)
Testing Boundaries (DoS, Brute force attacks etc.)
Any VPN or port numbers are needed and verify those ahead of time
Web application firewalls and other IDS in place
Timeframe of the assessment (dates and hours)

Phases.Name: Reconnaissance
Phases.Description: Gather as much information as possible about the target system. The goal is to map out the digital footprint of the target and identify potential entry points.

Tools.Name: whois enumeration
Tools.Description: Tool to gather domain registration details.

Tools.Name: prips
Tools.Description: Tool for IP range generation on Linux.

Tools.Name: urlscan
Tools.Description: A tool for scanning and analyzing website URLs.

Tools.Name: robtex
Tools.Description: Provides DNS and domain based information gathering.

Phases.Name: Scanning
Phases.Description: Identify open ports, active services, and vulnerabilities.

Tools.Name: Accunetix
Tools.Description: Automated tool to scan and identify web application vulnerabilities.

Tools.Name: OpenVas
Tools.Description: Open source vulnerability scanner and manager.

Tools.Name: Vega
Tools.Description: A free and open source web security scanner.

Phases.Name: Exploitation
Phases.Description: Actively exploiting identified vulnerabilities to gain unauthorized access or escalate privileges within the system.

Tools.Name: CyberChef
Tools.Description: A web app for encryption, encoding, compression, and data analysis.

Phases.Name: Post Exploitation
Phases.Description: Determine the potential damage and data exposure that could occur. It involves exploring the compromised system to understand the depth of access obtained.

Tools.Name: Empire
Tools.Description: Powershell framework for remote and post exploitation.

Phases.Name: Reporting
Phases.Description: Compiling findings, methodologies, and evidence into a comprehensive report.

Tools.Name: Typst
Tools.Description: Tool used for generating formatted pentest reports.

Resources.Name: Kali-reporting-tools
Resources.Description: A collection of tools available in Kali for reporting.

Resources.Name: Pentest-methodology
Resources.Description: A repository providing methodologies for penetration testing.

Resources.Name: OSINT Framework
Resources.Description: Framework for organizing tools used during the open source intelligence phase of a security assessment.
